--- title: "1.2 — Meet R — Class Content" execute: freeze: auto --- ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {.callout-note appearance=minimal} # Meeting Dates *Thursday, August 26, 2021* ::: ::: .{callout-warning} # Upcoming Assignment Please complete the [preliminary survey](/assignment/00-preliminary-survey). ::: ## Overview Today we begin the long slog to your mastery of `R`. We begin with the basics - how R works, how to use it, the different data types, and how to create and manipulate objects. ## Readings - Ch.1 in Wickham & Grolemund, [http://r4ds.had.co.nz/introduction.html](R for Data Science) Now that we start working with R, you should consider this book to be your *primary* reference for R-related questions. We will broadly cover the first few chapters in order over the next 2-3 class periods. ## R Practice Today we will be working on [practice problems](/r/1.2-r). Answers will be posted later on that page. ## Slides Below, you can find the slides in two formats. Clicking the image will bring you to the html version of the slides in a new tab. The lower button will allow you to download a PDF version of the slides. I suggest printing the slides beforehand and using them to take additional notes in class (*not everything* is in the slides)!

Download as PDF

## Assignments ### Preliminary Statistics Survey Please take the [preliminary survey](/assignment/00-preliminary-survey) on your statistics and software background. This will help us all have a productive semester together.
